Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Charles Galbreath, Clarendon Road Church, 3304 Clarendon Road Brooklyn, New York 11203.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Williams.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Charles Galbreath, Clarendon Road Church, 3304 Clarendon Road, Brooklyn, New York 11203.



Council Member Williams moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 14, 2012 be adopted as printed by Council Member Dromm.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Dromm moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 14, 2012 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of James Stolpinski to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the Waterfront Management Advisory Board.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: James Stolpinski, Waterfront Management Advisory Board.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Comrie
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application nos. C 070512 MMK, C120111PPK and C 120109 ZAK shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. C 120108 ZMK that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Amendment to City Map, Brooklyn (C070512MMK,  C120111PPK,  C120109 ZAK and C120108ZMK)

Report of the Committee on Civil Service and Labor

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the waiver of public employee organizations’ rights when submitting grievances to arbitration under the New York city collective bargaining law.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring various agencies to distribute information on how to obtain a library card.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring various agencies to distribute information on how to obtain a library card.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the Mayor of the proposed executive budget and budget message, the date of submission by the Borough Presidents of recommendations in response to the Mayor’s executive budget, the date of publication of a report by the director of the independent budget office analyzing the executive budget, the date by which the Council hearings pertaining to the executive budget shall conclude, the date by which if the expense budget has not been adopted, the expense budget and tax rate adopted as modified for the current fiscal year shall be deemed to have been extended for the new fiscal year until such time as a new expense budget has been adopted, the date by which if a capital budget and a capital program have not been adopted, the unutilized portion of all prior capital appropriations shall be deemed reappropriated, the date of submission by the Mayor of an estimate of the probable amount of receipts, the date by which any person or organization may submit an official alternative estimate of revenues, the date by which if the Council has not fixed the tax rates for the ensuing fiscal year, the commissioner of finance shall be authorized to complete the assessment rolls using estimated rates, and related matters, relating to the fiscal year two thousand thirteen.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Date of submission by the Mayor of the proposed executive budget and budget message.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the New York city false claims act.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: New York city false claims act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.27/A.1883, legislation which would establish the Asian Lunar New Year as an official holiday for New York City students.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Establish the Asian Lunar New Year as an official holiday for NYC students.  (S.27/A.1883)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to capturing methane at New York city municipally-owned solid waste landfills.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Capturing methane at New York city municipally-owned solid waste landfills.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to elimination of permit and or filing fees for green building projects undertaken on one to four family homes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Elimination of permit and or filing fees for green building projects undertaken on one to four family homes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to speed limits when passing vehicles engaged in the collection of waste.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Speed limits when passing vehicles engaged in the collection of waste.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to safety rules and procedures for employees engaged in the collection of waste and recyclables.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Safety rules and procedures for employees engaged in the collection of waste and recyclables.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Education to calculate salaries of teachers in the New York City public school system based on the Department’s central budget, rather than an individual school’s budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to calculate salaries of teachers in the NYC public school system based on the Department’s central budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disclosure of smoking policies for class A multiple dwellings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of smoking policies for class A multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend the Arts and Cultural Affairs Law to define “e-ticket,” “paperless ticket” and “paperless ticketing system,” and calling for greater enforcement of current law relating to the transferability of tickets.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Amend the Arts and Cultural Affairs Law to define “e-ticket,” “paperless ticket” and “paperless ticketing system".

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the New York city panel on climate change and the New York city climate change adaptation task force.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: NYC panel on climate change and the NYC climate change adaptation task force.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the dept of sanitation to ensure the removal of snow and ice from fire hydrants.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring food vendors to post prices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a sidewalk litter exemption on holidays during which alternate side parking is suspended.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk litter exemption on holidays during which alternate side parking is suspended.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to disapprove the proposed increase in the “Minimum Rent” for Section 8 voucher holders as proposed in the second draft, dated October 5, 2011, of the Section 8 Savings Act of 2011 released by the Majority Leadership of the House Committee on Financial Services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Disapprove the proposed increase in the “Minimum Rent” for Section 8 voucher holders as proposed in the second draft, dated October 5, 2011.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Envrionmental Protection
Environmental Protection

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of environmental protection to undertake an assessment of the electricity generation capability of the city’s water supply and wastewater treatment systems and bodies of water within the city’s jurisdiction.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of environmental protection to undertake an assessment of the electricity generation capability of the city’s water supply and wastewater treatment systems and bodies of water within the city’s jurisdiction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of environmental protection to undertake an assessment of the electricity generation capability of the city’s water supply and wastewater treatment systems and bodies of water within the city’s jurisdiction.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on GO with a Message of Necessity
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of environmental protection to undertake an assessment of the electricity generation capability of the city’s water supply and wastewater treatment systems and bodies of water within the city’s jurisdiction.

Items.Title:
By Council Member Quinn:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226 (g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 7 9th Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Committee Board no. 2, Application 20125364 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
